column1: Welcome to the **Login Page Test Cases**! This document contains a comprehensive collection of test cases for testing the functionality, security, and usability of a login page.

column3: **Test Case**
column5: **Expected Result**

column3: Verify that the cursor is focused on the "Username" text box on page load.
column5: Cursor is automatically focused on the "Username" field upon page load.

column3: Verify that the login screen contains required elements (Username, Password, Sign-in button, etc.).
column5: All specified elements are present and correctly displayed.

column3: Verify tab functionality across all form elements.
column5: Focus moves sequentially through all form elements using the Tab key.

column3: Verify that the Enter key works as a substitute for the Sign-in button.
column5: Pressing Enter submits the form and initiates login.

column3: Verify that Username and Password fields have meaningful placeholders.
column5: Placeholders provide appropriate guidance (e.g., "Enter your username").

column3: Verify that labels float upward when the text field is focused or filled (if applicable).
column5: Labels move upward and remain visible when fields are in focus or contain input.

column3: Verify that the user can log in with valid credentials.
column5: Login is successful, and the user is redirected to the correct page.

column3: Verify that login fails with invalid Username and Password.
column5: Error message is displayed: "Invalid Username or Password."

column3: Verify that login fails with a valid Username and invalid Password.
column5: Error message is displayed: "Invalid Password."

column3: Verify that login fails with an invalid Username and valid Password.
column5: Error message is displayed: "Invalid Username."

column3: Verify that login fails with blank Username or Password fields.
column5: Validation error message: "Fields cannot be empty."

column3: Verify that login fails when spaces are entered as Username or Password.
column5: Spaces are trimmed or flagged as invalid input, and an error message is displayed.

column3: Verify that login fails with inactive credentials.
column5: Error message: "Your account is inactive. Contact support."

column3: Verify that clicking the browser back button after login does not log the user out.
column5: User remains logged in, and sensitive pages are not cached or accessible.

column3: Verify that clicking the browser back button after logout does not log the user back in.
column5: User remains logged out.

column3: Verify that there is a limit on the number of unsuccessful login attempts.
column5: After X failed attempts, either CAPTCHA is shown or the account is temporarily locked.

column3: Verify that passwords entered in the Password field are encrypted (masked).
column5: Password characters are replaced with dots or asterisks.

column3: Verify that passwords copied from the Password field remain encrypted.
column5: Copy-pasted passwords are not decipherable or remain encrypted.

column3: Verify that the login page is not vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.
column5: SQL injection attempts fail with no sensitive data revealed, and an error is displayed.

column3: Verify that the login page is not vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks.
column5: XSS attempts are blocked; malicious scripts are not executed.

column3: Verify CAPTCHA functionality, including refresh, case sensitivity, and audio support.
column5: CAPTCHA works as intended, providing accessibility and security.

column3: Verify that the user remains logged in after signing in, closing the browser, and reopening the application.
column5: User remains logged in (if "Keep me logged in" was selected).

column3: Verify that invalid login attempts reveal no sensitive information in the page source.
column5: Sensitive information is not visible in the page source.

column3: Verify that the login form functions correctly across different browsers and devices.
column5: No UI or functionality issues across major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) and mobile devices.

column1: - Clear priorities and expected results for each test case.
- Enhanced security checks for SQL Injection and XSS vulnerabilities.
- Expanded usability tests for placeholders, floating labels, and tab functionality.
- Included CAPTCHA functionality tests for accessibility and security.
- Organized for readability and ease of execution.
